intro: Matelea denticulata, commonly known as the toothed matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with milky sap. The plant produces showy, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically pink or reddish in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Matelea denticulata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking blooms.
